timeline.bodyText: This will break possible deserialized configuration using lower-cased versions of these values
timeline.author: manusa

replies.bodyText:
Also, logic in line 87 of this same file will stop working too.
Please be very careful when changing enum fields. I'm more than happy to see enum field names with correct letter case, but right now we have a problem with how stuff gets deserialized from Maven configurations with plexus.
replies.author: manusa

timeline.bodyText:
This constant seems related to 
  
    
      jkube/jkube-kit/build/api/src/main/java/org/eclipse/jkube/kit/build/api/assembly/JKubeBuildTarArchiver.java
    
    
         Line 55
      in
      300fcfd
    
    
    
    

        
          
           File outputFile = new File(buildDirs.getTemporaryRootDirectory(), "docker-build." + (compression.equals(ArchiveCompression.none) ? "tar" : compression.getFileSuffix())); 
        
    
  

.
Maybe we should share at least the filename in some constant common to both classes (Preferably in the Archiver)
timeline.author: manusa

timeline.bodyText:
Does it make sense to add some log.info here to notify the user?
I think we are doing this in the Mojo, but it's probably better to move that here (think of future Gradle plugin)
timeline.author: manusa

timeline.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: Anyway, this enum constant is still used (nested) in Model configurations that can be deserialized (ImageConfiguration>WatchImageConfiugration). I strongly recommend to keep them lower case until we figure out a way to deserialize these value using some sort of case insensitive method (probably using a manual setter and constructor).
replies.author: manusa

timeline.author: manusa

timeline.bodyText: This parameter belongs now to BuildMojo (jib build strategy is applicable both for OpenShift and Kubernetes)
timeline.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: Ok, just saw it's in AbstractDockerMojo, please remove from here.

Fix #73: Ported JIB Support into Eclipse JKube from FMP

+ Added a new module `jkube-kit/build/service/jib`
+ Introduced a new `BuildService` for jib : `JibBuildService`
+ Added documentation related to JIB integration
+ Added a simple Spring Boot Quickstart for JIB support demonstration.

Move configuration classes to JKube Kit Image Config and JKube Kit Build API module

+ There are lots of classes like `ImageConfiguration`, `NetworkConfig`, `JKubeConfiguration` etc
  which were currently residing in JKube Kit Docker Build service module. It was okay till now
  since we have only one build service inside build service module. But as we are planning to add
  more services(JIB in this case), we would need to move these to a module where they can be
  accessed by other build services as well, hence moving them to `jkube-kit/config/image`.

+ Also Assembly related classes were also present inside JKube Kit Docker Build service module. In
  my opinion JKube Assembly should be independent of any kind of build service and should be a part
  of build api. This way all build Services could make use of JKube Build Assembly api in order to
  package application as tarballs. I have moved All *Assembly classes to `jkube-kit/build/api`
  module.
